description.zh-cn: 北宋时期的政治家和书法家，先后四次担任宰相，掌权共达十七年。因其政策与民争利、结党营私，被民间列为“六贼”之首。
description.en: A politician and calligrapher of the Northern Song Dynasty who served as prime minister four times, holding power for a total of seventeen years. He was notoriously known as the head of the 'Six Traitors' due to his policies that exploited the populace and his formation of political cliques.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上继五代十国之后的汉族政权，由赵匡胤建立。
description.en: A Han Chinese dynasty that followed the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period in Chinese history, founded by Zhao Kuangyin.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京与蔡卞之父，官至侍郎。
description.en: Father of Cai Jing and Cai Bian, who served as a Vice Minister (Shilang).

description.zh-cn: 蔡京之弟，王安石的女婿，官至枢密使、尚书左丞。
description.en: Younger brother of Cai Jing, son-in-law of Wang Anshi, who served as Commissioner of Military Affairs and Left Vice Director of the Department of State Affairs.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京长子，深得宋徽宗恩宠，官至领枢密院事。后与父蔡京不睦，形同仇敌。
description.en: Eldest son of Cai Jing, highly favored by Emperor Huizong of Song, and served as the head of the Bureau of Military Affairs. He later had a hostile relationship with his father, becoming like an enemy.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京第四子，官至徽猷阁待制，后遭兄蔡攸告发，贬死于白州。
description.en: Fourth son of Cai Jing, who served as an attendant in the Huiyou Pavilion. He was later denounced by his elder brother Cai You and exiled to Baizhou, where he died.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京第三子，曾任礼部尚书、保和殿大学士，于靖康元年被赐死。
description.en: Third son of Cai Jing, who served as Minister of Rites and Grand Academician of the Baohe Hall. He was ordered to commit suicide in the first year of the Jingkang era.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京第五子，娶宋徽宗之女茂德帝姬为妻，成为驸马。靖康之变时被掳至金国。
description.en: Fifth son of Cai Jing, who married Emperor Huizong's daughter, Princess Maode, becoming an imperial son-in-law. He was captured and taken to the Jin state during the Jingkang Incident.

description.zh-cn: 宋徽宗之女，嫁与蔡京之子蔡鞗。
description.en: Daughter of Emperor Huizong of Song, married to Cai Jing's son, Cai Tiao.

description.zh-cn: 北宋第八位皇帝，艺术造诣极高，但政治上昏庸，宠信蔡京、童贯等奸臣，导致北宋灭亡。
description.en: The eighth emperor of the Northern Song Dynasty, highly accomplished in the arts but a politically inept ruler. His favor towards corrupt officials like Cai Jing and Tong Guan led to the downfall of the Northern Song.

description.zh-cn: 由王安石推动的旨在富国强兵的社会改革运动。蔡京早年是其支持者，后又在绍圣年间恢复新法。
description.en: A series of socio-economic reforms aimed at enriching the state and strengthening the military, initiated by Wang Anshi. Cai Jing was an early supporter and later reinstated these policies during the Shaosheng era.

description.zh-cn: 北宋时期的政治家、史学家，元祐更化的主要推动者，尽废王安石新法。
description.en: A politician and historian of the Northern Song Dynasty, the main driver of the Yuanyou Reforms, who abolished all of Wang Anshi's New Policies.

description.zh-cn: 元祐年间，由司马光等人主导的政治运动，旨在全面废除王安石变法的新法。
description.en: A political movement during the Yuanyou era, led by Sima Guang and others, aimed at completely abolishing the New Policies of Wang Anshi's reforms.

description.zh-cn: 北宋政治家，新党领袖之一，绍圣年间执政，恢复王安石新法。
description.en: A Northern Song politician and one of the leaders of the New Policies faction. He held power during the Shaosheng era and reinstated Wang Anshi's New Policies.

description.zh-cn: 北宋末年宦官，深得宋徽宗宠信，与蔡京结交，同为“六贼”之一。
description.en: A eunuch in the late Northern Song Dynasty, deeply trusted by Emperor Huizong. He allied with Cai Jing and was also one of the 'Six Traitors'.

description.zh-cn: 指北宋末年六位被认为是导致国家败坏的奸臣，蔡京被列为首位。
description.en: Refers to six treacherous ministers in the late Northern Song Dynasty who were blamed for the state's decline, with Cai Jing ranked as the foremost.

description.zh-cn: 北宋宰相，后被蔡京排挤而罢相。
description.en: A prime minister of the Northern Song Dynasty who was later ousted from his position by Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 北宋太学生，钦宗即位后上书请求诛杀蔡京、童贯等“六贼”。
description.en: A student of the Imperial University in the Northern Song Dynasty who, after Emperor Qinzong's accession, submitted a memorial requesting the execution of Cai Jing, Tong Guan, and the other 'Six Traitors'.

description.zh-cn: 北宋末代皇帝，宋徽宗之子。即位后将蔡京贬谪。
description.en: The last emperor of the Northern Song Dynasty and son of Emperor Huizong. After ascending the throne, he demoted and exiled Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 北宋与金国制定的共同攻打辽国的盟约，蔡京是此盟约的参与制定者之一，该盟约被认为是导致北宋灭亡的重要因素。
description.en: An alliance treaty between the Northern Song and the Jin state to jointly attack the Liao dynasty. Cai Jing was one of its framers, and the alliance is considered a significant factor leading to the downfall of the Northern Song.

description.zh-cn: 南宋第二位皇帝。即位后，下诏为蔡京平反昭雪。
description.en: The second emperor of the Southern Song Dynasty. After ascending the throne, he issued an edict to posthumously rehabilitate Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京的出生地。
description.en: The birthplace of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京的逝世地。
description.en: The place of death of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京是蔡准的长子。
description.en: Cai Jing is the eldest son of Cai Zhun.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京是蔡卞的兄长。
description.en: Cai Jing is the elder brother of Cai Bian.

description.zh-cn: 蔡攸是蔡京的长子。
description.en: Cai You is the eldest son of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡绦是蔡京的第四子。
description.en: Cai Tao is the fourth son of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡翛是蔡京的第三子。
description.en: Cai Xiao is the third son of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡鞗是蔡京的第五子。
description.en: Cai Tiao is the fifth son of Cai Jing.

description.zh-cn: 蔡鞗迎娶宋徽宗之女茂德帝姬为妻。
description.en: Cai Tiao married Princess Maode, the daughter of Emperor Huizong.

description.zh-cn: 茂德帝姬是宋徽宗的女儿。
description.en: Princess Maode is the daughter of Emperor Huizong.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京于熙宁三年进士及第，在北宋朝廷中任官，先后四次担任宰相，最高至太师。
description.en: Cai Jing passed the imperial examination in 1070 and served in the Northern Song court, serving as prime minister four times and reaching the highest position of Grand Preceptor.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京早年支持王安石变法，并在绍圣元年（1094年）与章惇一同恢复免役法等新法政策。
description.en: Cai Jing supported Wang Anshi's reforms in his early years and, together with Zhang Dun, reinstated the New Policies such as the Hired Service Law in 1094.

description.zh-cn: 在元祐更化期间，蔡京遵从司马光的指令，在五日内将开封府的募役法改回差役法，受到司马光称赞。
description.en: During the Yuanyou Reforms, Cai Jing followed Sima Guang's orders and reverted the Hired Service Law back to the Corvée Labor Law in Kaifeng Prefecture within five days, earning praise from Sima Guang.

description.zh-cn: 元祐更化时期，司马光执政，蔡京时任开封府知府，执行了司马光废除新法的政策。
description.en: During the Yuanyou Reforms, when Sima Guang was in power, Cai Jing served as the prefect of Kaifeng and implemented Sima Guang's policy of abolishing the New Policies.

description.zh-cn: 绍圣元年（1094年），章惇秉政，蔡京积极赞助章惇，恢复新法。
description.en: In 1094, when Zhang Dun was in power, Cai Jing actively supported him in reinstating the New Policies.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京是宋徽宗时期最受恩宠的权臣，长期担任宰相，深刻影响了徽宗一朝的政治。
description.en: Cai Jing was the most favored and powerful minister during Emperor Huizong's reign, serving as prime minister for a long period and profoundly influencing the politics of his era.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京在失势后结交宦官童贯，得以重新获得宋徽宗的任用。二人同为“六贼”，共同主导了宣和攻辽等重大决策。
description.en: After falling from power, Cai Jing allied with the eunuch Tong Guan to regain favor with Emperor Huizong. Both were members of the 'Six Traitors' and jointly led major decisions such as the war against the Liao during the Xuanhe era.

description.zh-cn: 崇宁元年（1102年），蔡京排挤掉时任宰相韩忠彦，自己得以复用并最终拜相。
description.en: In 1102, Cai Jing ousted the incumbent prime minister Han Zhongyan, enabling his own return to power and eventual appointment as prime minister.

description.zh-cn: 钦宗即位后，太学生陈东上书，将蔡京列为“六贼”之首，请求将其诛杀。
description.en: After Emperor Qinzong ascended the throne, the imperial university student Chen Dong submitted a memorial listing Cai Jing as the head of the 'Six Traitors' and called for his execution.

description.zh-cn: 靖康元年（1126年），宋钦宗即位后，将蔡京连续贬谪，最终移送至儋州，蔡京在途中病死。
description.en: In 1126, after Emperor Qinzong of Song ascended the throne, he successively demoted and exiled Cai Jing, ultimately ordering his transfer to Danzhou. Cai Jing died of illness en route.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京长子蔡攸后来与父蔡京各立门户，关系恶化至仇敌。蔡攸曾借口蔡京有病试图使其罢官，并最终联合他人逼其辞职。
description.en: Cai Jing's eldest son, Cai You, later established his own faction and his relationship with his father deteriorated to the point of enmity. Cai You once used his father's alleged illness as a pretext to have him dismissed and eventually forced his resignation in collaboration with others.

description.zh-cn: 蔡攸嫉妒其弟蔡绦擅权用事，联合白时中、李邦彦告发蔡绦，并请求宋徽宗将其处死。
description.en: Jealous of his younger brother Cai Tao's abuse of power, Cai You conspired with Bai Shizhong and Li Bangyan to denounce him and requested Emperor Huizong to execute him.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京被民间舆论和后世史家视为北宋末年“六贼”之首，对北宋的败亡负有重要责任。
description.en: Cai Jing was regarded by public opinion and later historians as the head of the 'Six Traitors' of the late Northern Song, bearing significant responsibility for the dynasty's fall.

description.zh-cn: 童贯与蔡京等人一同被列为祸国殃民的“六贼”。
description.en: Tong Guan, along with Cai Jing and others, was listed as one of the 'Six Traitors' who brought disaster to the country and its people.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京参与制定了北宋与金国的“海上之盟”，该盟约旨在联合金国攻打辽国。
description.en: Cai Jing participated in the formulation of the 'Alliance on the Sea' between the Northern Song and the Jin state, which aimed to jointly attack the Liao dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 宋孝宗即位后，下诏为已故的蔡京平反昭雪，恢复其官职并追赠鲁国公，此举被视为对其政治遗产的某种程度的重新评价。
description.en: After ascending the throne, Emperor Xiaozong of Song issued an edict to posthumously rehabilitate the deceased Cai Jing, restoring his official titles and conferring upon him the title of Duke of Lu. This act is seen as a re-evaluation of his political legacy to some extent.

description.zh-cn: 蔡京出生于福建路兴化军仙游县。
description.en: Cai Jing was born in Xianyou County, Xinghua Prefecture, Fujian Circuit.
